rules.natural: If a drug treatment is effective, then the drug treatment is approved.
Either a drug treatment is effective or it is safe.
Under the condition that a drug treatment is safe, then if a veterinarian administers a drug to a mouse, it is not the case that the animal survives.
Whenever a drug treatment is approved, then if a veterinarian administers a drug to a mouse, it is not the case that the animal survives.
Either funding is available through a grant or an institute has funding.

Whenever a protocol requires approval, then if a regulator, the FDA, monitors, then if a drug treatment is effective, then if a veterinarian administers a drug to a mouse, it is not the case that the animal survives.
If an advisor recommends continuation, then a board reviews data.
Either an advisor recommends continuation or a consultant suggests modifications.
Under the condition that a consultant suggests modifications, then it is not the case that a committee halts a trial.
Provided that a regulator approves a trial by the FDA, then if a researcher tests on a mouse animal, then if an organization develops a drug in a company, then a researcher does not use a microscope.
Either a regulator approves a trial by the FDA or a researcher conducts an experiment.

If a scientist analyzes data results, then if a researcher conducts an experiment, then if a researcher tests on a mouse animal, then if an organization develops a drug in a company, then a researcher does not use a microscope.
Either a scientist analyzes data results or a researcher publishes a paper with findings.

Under the condition that a researcher publishes a paper with findings, then if a researcher conducts an experiment, then if a researcher tests on a mouse animal, then if an organization develops a drug in a company, then a researcher does not use a microscope.
If a veterinarian administers a drug to a mouse, then an animal survives.
Either a veterinarian administers a drug to a mouse or an institute has funding.
If it is not the case that either a lab has equipment in the form of a tool or funding is not available through a grant, then a company expands its facility.
Under the condition that it is not the case that either a scientist receives an award or if a company expands its facility, then a team continues research, then a department terminates a project.
Whenever it is not the case that a protocol requires approval, then a committee halts a trial.
If an institute does not have funding, then a researcher uses a microscope.

facts.natural: An organization develops a drug in a company.
A researcher tests on a mouse animal.
A lab does not have equipment in the form of a tool.
A team does not continue research.
A scientist does not receive an award.
A department does not terminate a project.
A board does not review data.

An institute has funding.

A committee does not halt a trial.

(A10 → (A8 → ¬A9)).natural: Provided that a drug treatment is effective, then if a veterinarian administers a drug to a mouse, it is not the case that the animal survives.

(A10 → A12).natural: If a drug treatment is effective, then the drug treatment is approved.

(A10 ∨ A11).natural: Either a drug treatment is effective or it is safe.

(A11 → (A8 → ¬A9)).natural: Under the condition that a drug treatment is safe, then if a veterinarian administers a drug to a mouse, it is not the case that the animal survives.

(A12 → (A8 → ¬A9)).natural: Whenever a drug treatment is approved, then if a veterinarian administers a drug to a mouse, it is not the case that the animal survives.

(A13 ∨ G).natural: Either funding is available through a grant or an institute has funding.

(A14 ∨ ¬A13).natural: Either a lab has equipment in the form of a tool or funding is not available through a grant.

(A16 → A15).natural: If a company expands its facility, then a team continues research.

(A17 ∨ (A16 → A15)).natural: Either a scientist receives an award or if a company expands its facility, then a team continues research.

(A19 → (A10 → (A8 → ¬A9))).natural: Provided that a regulator, the FDA, monitors, then if a drug treatment is effective, then if a veterinarian administers a drug to a mouse, it is not the case that the animal survives.

(A2 → ¬A1).natural: If an organization develops a drug in a company, then a researcher does not use a microscope.

(A20 → (A19 → (A10 → (A8 → ¬A9)))).natural: Whenever a protocol requires approval, then if a regulator, the FDA, monitors, then if a drug treatment is effective, then if a veterinarian administers a drug to a mouse, it is not the case that the animal survives.

(A22 ∨ ¬A21).natural: Either a board reviews data or it is not the case that a committee halts a trial.

(A23 → A22).natural: If an advisor recommends continuation, then a board reviews data.

(A24 → ¬A21).natural: Under the condition that a consultant suggests modifications, then it is not the case that a committee halts a trial.

(A3 → (A2 → ¬A1)).natural: If a researcher tests on a mouse animal, then if an organization develops a drug in a company, then a researcher does not use a microscope.

(A5 → (A3 → (A2 → ¬A1))).natural: Whenever a researcher conducts an experiment, then if a researcher tests on a mouse animal, then if an organization develops a drug in a company, then a researcher does not use a microscope.

(A6 → (A5 → (A3 → (A2 → ¬A1)))).natural: If a scientist analyzes data results, then if a researcher conducts an experiment, then if a researcher tests on a mouse animal, then if an organization develops a drug in a company, then a researcher does not use a microscope.

(A6 ∨ A7).natural: Either a scientist analyzes data results or a researcher publishes a paper with findings.

(A7 → (A5 → (A3 → (A2 → ¬A1)))).natural: Under the condition that a researcher publishes a paper with findings, then if a researcher conducts an experiment, then if a researcher tests on a mouse animal, then if an organization develops a drug in a company, then a researcher does not use a microscope.

(A8 → A9).natural: If a veterinarian administers a drug to a mouse, then an animal survives.

(A8 → ¬A9).natural: If a veterinarian administers a drug to a mouse, then it is not the case that the animal survives.

(A8 ∨ G).natural: Either a veterinarian administers a drug to a mouse or an institute has funding.

(¬(A14 ∨ ¬A13) → A15).natural: Provided that it is not the case that either a lab has equipment in the form of a tool or funding is not available through a grant, then a team continues research.

(¬(A14 ∨ ¬A13) → A16).natural: If it is not the case that either a lab has equipment in the form of a tool or funding is not available through a grant, then a company expands its facility.

(¬(A17 ∨ (A16 → A15)) → A18).natural: Under the condition that it is not the case that either a scientist receives an award or if a company expands its facility, then a team continues research, then a department terminates a project.

(¬A20 → A21).natural: Whenever it is not the case that a protocol requires approval, then a committee halts a trial.

(¬G → A1).natural: If an institute does not have funding, then a researcher uses a microscope.
